comments:
Eclipse 3.2RC3.
steps:
1. Open a java file
2. Put the cursor in a line
3. Press CTRL + ALT + Down to copy the line
4. Close the java file without saving
5. Open the file again
6. We can see the discarded changes are shown again

Works for me using 3.2 RC3 and the Java editor.

Do you see this in an Eclipse SDK downloaded and installed into an empty directory without any additional plug-ins?

Anything in .log?

I also can't reproduce it when I restart my eclipse. Here is the errors in .log file. It maybe has no relationship with this bug, but I guess it is still an eclipse bug.  Just fyi.

What I think might have happened is that the same file was open twice (or more)in another editor. In that case the buffer is still active and reopening shows you the buffer.

traces.message: All triggers in a trigger sequence must be an instance of Trigger
